Hello? Can you hear me? I'm Brendan Fraser, and I'm an actor! Well, sort of. Okay, I'm a decent enough thespian, but don't quote me on that. I was born in Indianapolis, Indiana, on December 3, 1968, to a family of modest means. My dad was a carpenter, and my mom was a librarian – yeah, real exciting stuff. As a kid, I was a bit of a wild card. I spent my formative years playing in the woods, getting into mischief, and breaking things (usually my mom's favorite vase, if I'm being honest). But hey, it's not like I was a total troublemaker... much. In high school, I was that kid who got lost on the way to gym class, but hey, at least I was enthusiastic about it, right?

After high school, I packed up my bags and headed to the University of Southern California to study drama. Yeah, I know, it's not like I was destined for greatness or anything... but I got lucky, I guess. My big break came when I landed a role on the TV show "Capital Critics" – it was a real thrill-ride, let me tell you. Then, somehow, I managed to snag a spot in the cast of "The Wild Thornberrys" – now that was a real swing-and-a-miss, am I right?

But hey, I got a second chance when I landed the lead role in the film "Encino Man" – yeah, it was a bit of a stinker, but hey, I looked good in a loincloth, if I do say so myself. And then, of course, there was "The Mummy" – oh boy, that was a real game-changer. I mean, who wouldn't want to play an American adventurer stuck in ancient Egypt with a bunch of mummies? Sounds like a real hoot, am I right?

Since then, I've been in a bunch of other movies and TV shows, some of which were actually pretty good, I think. But hey, I'm not one to brag... much. I've won a few awards, gotten a few nominations, and even got to work with some pretty big-name directors – but let's be real, I'm still just Brendan Fraser, that guy who played the mummy- wrangling, treasure

Brendan Fraser was born on December 3, 1968, in Indianapolis, Indiana, to a family of modest means. His parents, Peter and Carol Fraser, were both free-spirited artists who instilled in him a love for the performing arts.
